content: In for example the inline-generator MIR test, we generate MIR that calls SetDiscriminant on a ty::Opaque type. Is this indicative of a missing reveal somewhere and not actually supposed to happen? If this is by design, is there some intuition for when I should expect to be able to find a ty::Opaque and when not?
Oh fun... maybe the deaggregator should also reveal all opaque types? They only need to stay opaque for borrowck and friends, not for optimizations
